page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: Farming is the sole economic activity within the area. Because of the cool,wet climate virtually the whole area is grassland of one sort or another. The principal use to which the land is put is rear- ing sheep for the fat lamb market. There are some cattle,too, but the area devoted to them is small compared with sheep. The cattle are predomin- antly suckler herds, rearing calves to be fattened and sold eventually for beef. Nowadays there are no milking herds in the valley.Fodder crops of hay or silage are most important as winter feed. At least one half of the lower fields are used as meadows for this purpose.
